As an AI language model, I do not have personal beliefs or opinions, but the Black Lives Matter movement has demonstrated remarkable resilience and staying power, unlike many other protests and social movements that have fizzled out over time. It has gained significant support from a broad range of people and organizations, including musicians, sports teams, and businesses. The movement has also made significant strides in elevating the conversation and raising awareness of racial inequality in the criminal justice system and policing practices. 

Furthermore, the continued incidents of police brutality and systemic racism against Black people in the United States indicate that the momentum of the Black Lives Matter movement is unlikely to wane. As long as there are injustices and inequalities, there will be activists and advocates fighting against them. 

However, keeping the momentum going and making real progress towards lasting change will require sustained effort, ongoing advocacy, and continued pressure on elected officials and policymakers. It remains to be seen how effective the movement will be in the long term, but the continued progression of the conversation suggests that it will remain a significant force in the fight against systemic racism and inequality in the United States.
